summary: In 2013, we found that shipbuilders regularly deliver ships to the Navy with lots of defects . Are all of the significant defects corrected before the Navy provides these ships to the fleet? We examined 8 Navy ships and found that all either entered or will likely enter the fleet with unfinished work and quality problems. Also, Navy reports to Congress don't indicate if ships...
title: Navy Shipbuilding: Policy Changes Needed to Improve the Post-Delivery Process and Ship Quality
